JobFullDesc: The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team develops hypotheses and designs and conducts research studies to investigate those hypotheses. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role you will pair your analytical skills with Facebook’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising.You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform creative development and build systems that achieve our clients’ business objectives. While the role is based in the USA, you will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook,  Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to measure and communicate effective strategies for online advertising and brand communications.Design and execute custom primary research using a wide variety of quantitative methods and interpret outcomes through the lens of creative (including visual, linguistic, and conceptual elements).Establish best practices in consumer-facing communications by applying inferential statistical methods including experimental design.Partner with cross-functional teams including Creative Shop, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Sales to develop solutions that make your work scalable.Package research effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Behavioral Science, Applied
